attributes.Title: S-Sport Marketing Research
attributes.Description:
Spring
2015
Sport Management
493C
UMass Amherst
Marketing research is a fundamental component of any sport business decision.  In this class we will discuss the various uses of marketing research, how to identify and utilize appropriate qualitative and quantitative research techniques, how to recognize effective and ineffective research, and how to appropriately interpret and apply the results.
Open to Senior & Junior Sport Management majors only.
Permission is required for interchange registration during the add/drop period only.
15266

attributes.Title: Honors Project
attributes.Description:
Spring
2016
Sport Management
499P
UMass Amherst
Not available at this time
Contact COMCOL  To add this course, find a faculty sponsor with whom to plan your work. Submit your proposal through CHC PATHS (honors.umass.edu/chc-paths/) for online approval by your sponsor and other reviewers, including the Academic Standards Committee of the Faculty Senate?s Commonwealth Honors College Council. Once fully approved it will be registered in SPIRE by Commonwealth Honors College.
Varies from 3 to 6 credits
Permission is required for interchange registration during the add/drop period only.
65591

attributes.Title: Soc-Hstcl Fnd Mod Sp
attributes.Description:
Fall
2015
Sport Management
661
UMass Amherst
Critical historical analysis of sport as a social structure in the U.S. Key areas of exploration include sport as a cultural product, social relations within sport, sport management structures, and contemporary social issues. Mr. Crosset
Open to Graduate SPORTMGT students only.
Permission is required for interchange registration during the add/drop period only.
35675

attributes.Title: S-Economics of Sports
attributes.Description:
Spring
2016
Sport Management
692A
UMass Amherst
Students use economic analysis to study a wide variety of issues affecting the sport industry. Topics examined include: optimal ticket pricing strategies; the effects of free agency and collective bargaining processes on player salaries; the effects of league-wide policies such as revenue-sharing, salary caps, and luxury taxes on team financial performance and on league competitive balance, and; the impacts and rationales for government subsidization of stadiums. Both professional and college sports are examined.
Open to graduate SPORTMGT and ISOM students only.
Permission is required for interchange registration during the add/drop period only.
65623

attributes.Title: Sport Finance&Busins
attributes.Description:
Fall
2015
Sport Management
624
UMass Amherst
Analysis of the financial and economic issues related to the operation of public and private sport organizations. Exploration of specific areas of student interest through development of comprehensive business plans. Specific topics include: structure of sport industry; determinants of profitability; forms of ownership, tax-ation, financing, and economic impact studies. Mr. DeSchriver
Open to Graduate SPORTMGT students only.
Permission is required for interchange registration during the add/drop period only.
35673

attributes.Title: S-Sport Leadership
attributes.Description:
Fall
2014
Sport Management
595C
UMass Amherst
This course is based on the premise that while knowledge of leadership that is captured by readings, structured, and presented by professors in the classroom is a valuable tool for learning, it can be complemented by learning directly from experienced sport executives.  This process of combining theory with leadership lessons from the "real world" will require you to read, reflect, write, and prepare diligently for 4-5 visits from top executives in the sport industry.  The following leadership components will be addressed and examined in this course: effective and ineffective leadership traits, attributes, and behaviors; transformational and developmental perspectives; team leadership; and crisis management, among other components.
The primary purpose of this course will be met by you having increased knowledge of leadership theory and techniques in sport organizations, improved ability to understand the collaborative nature of leadership, realized the importance of becoming aware (in real time) of your assumptions and the effect that those assumptions may have on how you learn current leadership strategies, and recognized that leadership does not occur in a vacuum and that your actions and behaviors have implications on others (leaders and followers).
Open to Senior and Junior Sport Management majors, and to Sport Management graduate students only.
Permission is required for interchange registration during the add/drop period only.
75179

attributes.Title: Economics Of Sport
attributes.Description:
Fall
2015
Sport Management
485
UMass Amherst
The use of economic analysis to analyze issues related to the sport industry.  Topics include ticket pricing strategies, monopolization, players' labor markets, revenue-sharing, salary caps, competitive balance, and the subsidization of stadiums.
Open to Sport Management majors only. ECON 103 or RES-ECON 102
Permission is required for interchange registration during the add/drop period only.
35742

attributes.Title: Ideas That Change the World
attributes.Description:
Spring
2015
Honors College
201
UMass Amherst
In this seminar, students will examine texts and works of art that have profoundly shaped the world we live in. The course is divided into four units: Models of Inquiry; the Impact of Science and Technology; Social Philosophy and Civic Engagement; and Art in the World. The course is supplemented with several plenary lectures by distinguished honors faculty speakers.
This course is open to Commonwealth Honors College students only.
Permission is required for interchange registration during the add/drop period only.
16389

2016

298

Not available at this time.
Open to Sport Management majors only.

attributes.Description:
Spring
2016
Sport Management
424
UMass Amherst
Basic theory in finance and accounting applied to managerial control of sport organizations. Includes forms of ownership, taxation, financial analysis, feasibility studies, and economic impact studies.
Open to Sport Management majors only. Pre Req: FOMGT 300 or 301

Open to all majors.
Multiple required components--lab and/or discussion section. To register, submit requests for all components simultaneously.

attributes.Description:
Spring
2016
Sport Management
375
UMass Amherst
An investigation of the functions of management in terms of operating and financing public assembly facilities. Includes public and private arenas, coliseums, and stadiums.
Open to Senior, Junior and Sophomore Sport Management majors.
Multiple required components--lab and/or discussion section. To register, submit requests for all components simultaneously.
Permission is required for interchange registration during the add/drop period only.

attributes.Title: S-International Sport Mgt
attributes.Description:
Fall
2015
Sport Management
493A
UMass Amherst
Promotes critical thinking and understanding of international cultural issues as related to sport business. Students will learn the Olympic movement and globalization of sport. The club based system will be examined.
Open to Sport Management majors only.
Permission is required for interchange registration during the add/drop period only.
40916

attributes.Title: S-Sport Entrepreneurship
attributes.Description:
Spring
2016
Sport Management
392D
UMass Amherst
This course is designed to provide students with a foundational "road-map"
for starting a new business in the sports industry.  The course will clearly and methodically outline the key issues, current thinking, problems, and solutions one will face over the course of an entrepreneurial venture or career.  Upon successful completion of this course, students will have the knowledge base upon which to plan, launch, and grow an entrepreneurial venture; and/or be a contributing member of an entrepreneurial startup team.
Open to Senior, Junior and Sophomore Sport Management majors.
Permission is required for interchange registration during the add/drop period only.
65652

attributes.Title: S-Sport and New Media
attributes.Description:
Spring
2016
Sport Management
392C
UMass Amherst
This course will revolve around how various sport properties are leveraging new media and new technologies, specifically, the Internet and mobile technology.  Modules to be discussed include ecommerce, sponsorship, social networking and online communities, streaming video, user-enhanced content, and user-generated content.
Open to Senior, Junior and Sophomore Sport Management majors.
Permission is required for interchange registration during the add/drop period only.
70228

attributes.Title: ST-Sport Analytics
attributes.Description:
Spring
2016
Sport Management
497D
UMass Amherst
Students will use analytics to study a wide variety of issues affecting the sport industry.  Topics examined include: player performance measurement, in-game decision making, player selection/team building, and general administration such as marketing, pricing, contracts, stadium management, etc.  Students will learn not only how the recent application of analytics has improved each of these areas within the professional and collegiate sport industry, but also how analytics can improve decision making in any other field of business.
Open to Sport Management majors only.
Permission is required for interchange registration during the add/drop period only.
69637

attributes.Description:

2016
Sport Management
396
UMass Amherst
Projects, papers, or research. Must be approved and sponsored by a faculty member and approved by the chair of the curriculum committee.

attributes.Title: ST-Race and Sport
attributes.Description:
Fall
2014
Sport Management
497C
UMass Amherst
Race and Sport investigates how racial and gender formation degraded, defamed and denied women and people of color the opportunity to participate in sport.  The course will recognize the important milestones overcome and those yet to be broken.  This course puts a premium on students being able to critically analyze the institution of sport.
Open to Senior, Junior and Sophomore Sport Management majors.
Permission is required for interchange registration during the add/drop period only.

496

attributes.Description:
Fall
2015
Sport Management
694B
UMass Amherst
This course is designed to provide a comprehensive overview of the various segments within the sport industry. Students will assess their own personal and career interests and learn how to effectively research jobs, choose careers in line with those interests and market themselves to prospective employers.
Open to Graduate SPORTMGT students only.
Permission is required for interchange registration during the add/drop period only.
35705

attributes.Title: Introduction to Microeconomics
attributes.Description:
Spring
2016
Economics
103
UMass Amherst
Introduction to the economics of markets and market economies. Basic concepts of demand, supply, production, prices, allocation of resources, and distribution of income. Public policy applications. (Gen.Ed. SB)
The lecture and discussion sections of this course will not be overridden.  Students can enroll only through SPIRE into open sections, up to the capacity listed in SPIRE.  There is no override process for this course.
Students will attend Monday lectures in ILC.  On Wednesdays, they will be able to access a recording of the class and view lecture materials within hours of the meeting. In addition to lecture, classes will include time for discussion and cooperative work with other students.  Students will meet in weekly discussion sections as well.
Multiple required components--lab and/or discussion section. To register, submit requests for all components simultaneously.
Permission is required for interchange registration during the add/drop period only.
63534

attributes.Title: College Athletics
attributes.Description:
Spring
2016
Sport Management
323
UMass Amherst
An introduction to the management of college athletics, including a review of the organizational structure in regards to the intercollegiate athletic department, conferences, and the NCAA. Analysis of the prevailing issues in college athletics including financial trends, academic recruiting legislation, conference realignment, reform, and Title IX/gender equity.
Open to Senior, Junior and Sophomore Sport Management majors.
Permission is required for interchange registration during the add/drop period only.
65631

attributes.Title: Hnr Indstu In SPORTMGT
attributes.Description:
Spring
2015
Sport Management
296H
UMass Amherst
Not available at this time
Contact the Bloom Honors Advising Center - 201 Commonwealth Honors College - to add this course

15237

attributes.Title: ST-History of College Sports
attributes.Description:
Spring
2016
History
297S
UMass Amherst
In this course we search for the structure and enduring organization of college sports. We look for the development of college athletics that produced yesterday and today highly paid coaches, great fan enthusiasm, endless national media attention, and the opportunity for scandal and corruption. We search for the organic link that has bound intercollegiate sports to American higher education for over a century. This requires knowledge about what we were and what we have become. It is much easier to learn about what we have become than it is to learn about what we were. In this class, we do both.
Students must NOT have completed Sports Management 297S
Permission is required for interchange registration during the add/drop period only.
65661
62138

attributes.Title: Honors Colloq for SPORTMGT 200
attributes.Description:
Spring
2015
Sport Management
H200
UMass Amherst
Description not available at this time
Must be currently enrolled in SPORTMGT 200
Permission is required for interchange registration during all registration periods.
15263

attributes.Title: S-Sports Strategic Communicatn
attributes.Description:
Spring
2015
Sport Management
595A
UMass Amherst
Examines the various channels for communication within the sport industry. The primary focus will be an analysis of the ways in which sport organizations communicate directly with their target markets as well as in-depth discussion of the mediated devices used to consume sporting products. Topics include: public relations, the uses of television, radio, and print media, the growth of the Internet, and new sport communication technologies. Furthermore, students will be charged with identifying future communication tools and assessing their potential impact on sport.
This course is open to Graduate, Senior, or Junior Sport Management majors only.
Permission is required for interchange registration during the add/drop period only.
15270

attributes.Title: Sociology of Sport & Phys Act
attributes.Description:
Spring
2016
Sport Management
200
UMass Amherst
An examination of the social relations within the institution of sport and their role in the reproduction and transformation of society. Topics include socialization, stratification, gender relations, race and ethnicity, and social change.  (Gen.Ed. SB, U)
This course is open to Freshmen, Sophomores and Juniors.   120 seats reserved for freshmen and sophomore Sport Management majors.  80 seats reserved for freshmen, sophomores, and juniors of any major.  If you are unable to enroll via Spire, please fill out the online course override request available on the Isenberg website.
Multiple required components--lab and/or discussion section. To register, submit requests for all components simultaneously.
Permission is required for interchange registration during the add/drop period only.
65650
65610

attributes.Title: S- Business of Soccer
attributes.Description:
Spring
2016
Sport Management
491B
UMass Amherst
This course explores soccer around the world and its impact on local, national and the global economy. Students will study how the modern game has evolved at both club and national levels, paying specific attention to the financial impact of the major European leagues and the economic implications of European football competitions such as the UEFA Champions league. A comparison will be made of the European league model of promotion and regulation vs. the U.S. model currently used in MLS.
Students should have a general understanding of soccer prior to taking course.
Permission is required for interchange registration during the add/drop period only.
70063

attributes.Description:

2016
Sport Management
395C
UMass Amherst
This course is based on the premise that while knowledge of leadership that is captured by readings, structured, and presented by professors in the classroom is a valuable tool for learning, it can be complemented by learning directly from experienced sport executives.  This process of combining theory with leadership lessons from the "real world" will require you to read, reflect, write, and prepare diligently for 4-5 visits from top executives in the sport industry.  The following leadership components will be addressed and examined in this course: effective and ineffective leadership traits, attributes, and behaviors; transformational and developmental perspectives; team leadership; and crisis management, among other components.
Open to Senior & Junior Sport Management majors only. Pre Req: MANAGMNT 301  If you have already taken SPORTMGT 595C, you cannot take this class.
Permission is required for interchange registration during the add/drop period only.

2015

Permission is required for interchange registration during all registration periods.

attributes.Title: ST-History of Intrcollg Sports
attributes.Description:
Spring
2016
Sport Management
297S
UMass Amherst
In this course we search for the structure and enduring organization of college sports.  We look for the development of college athletics that produced yesterday and today highly paid coaches, great fan enthusiasm, endless national media attention, and the opportunity for scandal and corruption.  We search for the organic link that has bound intercollegiate sports to American higher education for over a century.  This requires knowledge about what we were and what we have become.  It is much easier to learn about what we have become than it is to learn about what we were.  In this class, we do both.
Meets with History 297S. Students must NOT have completed History 297S in order to enroll in this course.

attributes.Title: Corporation Finance
attributes.Description:
Spring
2016
Finance
301
UMass Amherst
The time value of money; valuation of financial securities; allocating capital; an introduction to risk and risky decision making; the financing decision of the firm; financial statement and working capital management; more special topics include mergers and acquisitions, and international finance.
Prerequisite:  ACCOUNTG 221
Senior, Junior, and Sophomore Economics majors, Resource Economics majors, or students in the Isenberg School of Management only. ACCOUNTG 221
Permission is required for interchange registration during the add/drop period only.
68176

attributes.Title: Professional Sports Industries
attributes.Description:
Fall
2015
Sport Management
377
UMass Amherst
An examination of professional team sports as well as individual based sports such as professional golf, tennis, auto-racing, and boxing including topics such as ownership, league operations, governance, the role and impact of television, labor/management relationships, licensing and sponsorship, and the perceived role of professional sport in American society.
Open to Sport Management majors only.
Permission is required for interchange registration during the add/drop period only.
35736

attributes.Description:
Spring
2016

698
UMass Amherst
Contact department for description.

65628

attributes.Title: ST-Adv Spt Sociology
attributes.Description:
Spring
2015
Sport Management
497A
UMass Amherst
The central focus of this class is the relationship between sport and the creation and maintenance of gender norms in society.  Using both contemporary and historical examples and cases, students will explore the effects on athletes, events and audiences of popular (and marginalized) beliefs about masculinity and femininity in sports.  Students will learn, discuss, and research issues including the intersections of gender with race, sexuality, religion, and class; the marketing and media coverage of male and female athletes and their respective sports; violence in sports; and gender equity legislation.  Both American and international sports, events, and athletes will be discussed and studied.
Open to Seniors, Juniors & Sophomores only.
Permission is required for interchange registration during the add/drop period only.
18543

attributes.Title: ST- Sports Promotion & Sales
attributes.Description:
Spring
2016
Sport Management
493H
UMass Amherst
This course builds upon Sport Marketing 321 through a more in-depth focus on the revenue-generation components of the sport industry. This course is divided into two sections: 1) retail-driven sales promotion (with focus on the tactics that companies use to leverage sport sponsorship); and 2) sport sales and sales management (with focus on theory and practice of relationship selling). This course includes an experiential learning-based project in which students develop and present a sport-themed sales promotion to industry executives.
Open to Senior Sport Management majors only. Pre Req: SPORTMGT 321  Meets with SPORTMGT 593B
Permission is required for interchange registration during the add/drop period only.
65659

335
UMass Amherst
A presentation of the basic legal system, its terminology, and principles as applied to professional and amateur sports. Emphasis on identifying and analyzing legal issues, the ramifications of those issues, and the means of limiting the liability of sport organizations.

2015

636

Analysis of nature and scope of the sport enterprise; investigates organizational behavior within the management of sport organizations; explores the area of human resource management; examines contemporary social problems and the future of sport. Ms. Barr

35721

attributes.Title: S-Sports Sales Strategy
attributes.Description:
Fall
2014
Sport Management
495H
UMass Amherst
This course is an experiential learning course requiring students to engage in the actual selling of local sport properties.  By the conclusion of the course, the student will, through discussion, investigation, role-playing, strategic analyses, field experience and guest lectures, understand how the concepts of relationship selling and aftermarketing impact the sales process; understand the various sales methodologies used in sport organizations (personal selling, telemarketing, direct mail, cyber sales, retailing); be able to define and design effective sales campaigns for a wide array of inventory, including tickets, sponsorships, signage, luxury suites, and game program advertising; critically evaluate and select the appropriate methodology to be used with the various types of products to be sold; identify and analyze problems related to initial sales and renewal type sales and be able to formulate alternatives and/or solutions; demonstrate sales presentation skills and demonstrate the ability to sell.
Open to Senior Sport Management majors only. Pre Req: SPORTMGT 321  Application and interview required.
Permission is required for interchange registration during all registration periods.

attributes.Description:

2016
Marketing
301

Open to Junior and Senior Isenberg majors, Contracting Departments-1, Resource Economics majors, and Stock School majors only.   Each student that enrolls in the Marketing 301 -01 session must also enroll in ONE of the additional breakout sessions; for example:  301 -AA, 301 -AB...... (as well as the -01 session).

attributes.Title: Honors Thesis Seminar
attributes.Description:
Spring
2016
Sport Management
499D
UMass Amherst
Course Topic- Sports Event Management
Taught by Mark McDonald
Pre Req: SPORTMGT 321  Course Title: Sports Event Mgt. Meets with SPORTMGT 492H and 594B. Application and interview required
Permission is required for interchange registration during all registration periods.
65668
65655

attributes.Title: Sport & The Law
attributes.Description:
Fall
2015
Sport Management
635
UMass Amherst
The law as it applies to professional and amateur sport organizations. In-depth analysis of contract law, tort law, constitutional law, administrative law, antitrust law, labor law, collective bargaining, and arbitration as it relates to sport. How to identify, analyze and understand legal issues, and the ramifications of those issues. Introduction to the case method of training in problem solving, the method upon which law is based. Each student makes at least one class presentation on current legal issues.
Open to Graduate SPORTMGT students only.
Permission is required for interchange registration during the add/drop period only.
35674

attributes.Title: Intro To Sport Mgt
attributes.Description:
Spring
2016
Sport Management
210
UMass Amherst
An overview of the business of sport, including career opportunities. A study of the value of professional management to sport organizations.
Open to Sport Management majors only.   Non Sport Management majors will need to fill out the online course override form available on the Isenberg website.
Permission is required for interchange registration during the add/drop period only.
65584

attributes.Title: Sports Policy
attributes.Description:
Spring
2016
Sport Management
494PI
UMass Amherst
Introduction to the analysis of strategic problems and decisions facing sport managers and leaders as well as ethical and implementation issues. This course for seniors integrates academic work from both General Education and major courses and satisfies the Integrative Experience requirement for SptMgt majors.  [No credit after SPORTMGT 480.]
Open to Senior Sport Management majors only. Pre Req: SPORTMGT 321
Permission is required for interchange registration during the add/drop period only.
65589

attributes.Description:
Spring
2016
Sport Management
296ISH
UMass Amherst
Not available at this time
Students must apply through CHC PATHS to add this course   To add this course, find a faculty sponsor with whom to plan your work. Submit your proposal through CHC PATHS (honors.umass.edu/chc-paths/) for online approval by your sponsor and other reviewers, including the Academic Standards Committee of the Faculty Senate?s Commonwealth Honors College Council. Once fully approved it will be registered in SPIRE by Commonwealth Honors College.
Varies from 3 to 6 credits
Permission is required for interchange registration during all registration periods.

attributes.Title: S-Sport Event Mgt
attributes.Description:
Spring
2016
Sport Management
594B
UMass Amherst
Topics essential to the management of sports events: finance, sponsorship, advertising, public relations, site preparation, tournament operations and risk management. Theoretical understanding enhanced through application of information to an actual event. Ms. Barr
Open to Graduate SPORTMGT students only.   Permission of the instructor required.  Meets with 492H and 499D.
Permission is required for interchange registration during all registration periods.
65655
65668

attributes.Title: Sport Marketing
attributes.Description:
Fall
2015
Sport Management
623
UMass Amherst
Concepts of marketing applied to professional, collegiate, amateur, and corporate settings. Emphasis on strategic marketing planning, marketing communication, branding, sponsorship development and fit, and promotional strategies and activities. Mr. Gladden
Open to Graduate SPORTMGT students only.
Permission is required for interchange registration during the add/drop period only.
35672

attributes.Title: ST-Sport Analytics
attributes.Description:
Spring
2016
Sport Management
697D
UMass Amherst
The course provides an introduction to business analytics within the context of the sport industry. It first examines the range of cross-disciplinary concepts and techniques that form the foundation for the field of business analytics. It then applies these concepts and techniques to both the administrative side of the sport business - like pricing decisions, stadium management, etc. - and to the on-field side. With the latter, topics include player performance measurement, in-game decision making, and player selection/team building.
Open to graduate SPORTMGT and ISOM students only.   Recommended prerequisite: Introductory statistics
Permission is required for interchange registration during the add/drop period only.
69079
Requisite: Open to graduate SPORTMGT and ISOM students only.   Recommended prerequisite: Introductory statistics

attributes.Title: S-Appl Spt Mktg Res
attributes.Description:
Spring
2016
Sport Management
693A
UMass Amherst
Survey design, implementation and an-alysis relating to sport audiences and consumers with a focus on brand management theory. Students participate in market research projects in conjunction with regional and national sports organizations. Lecture and field work. Mr. Gladden
Open to graduate SPORTMGT and ISOM students only.
Permission is required for interchange registration during the add/drop period only.
65595

attributes.Title: StrategicMgmtIssues/SportIndus
attributes.Description:
Spring
2016
Sport Management
680
UMass Amherst
What does it take to excel at the C-level (CEO, COO, CMO) of sports franchises? Through the integration of multiple disciplines (marketing, organizational behavior/development, law/risk management, finance, socio-cultural), this case study-based course challenges students to identify and address current strategic issues facing sport executives across a broad range of sport industries including professional teams, consultancies, college athletics, and manufacturers. Topical issues explored include entrepreneurship and the effective use of marketing and management analytics.
Open to Graduate SPORTMGT students only.
Permission is required for interchange registration during the add/drop period only.
65646

attributes.Title: Principles of Management
attributes.Description:
Spring
2016
Management
301
UMass Amherst
Overview of organizational behavior, operations management, and strategy/entrepreneurship.  Topics include: Behavioral background of formal organizational life, organizational design, integrating factors in collective behavior, organizational change, systems analysis, techniques of decision making and control, the organization and its environment, and the nature of management theory. Topics grouped in modules of organizational behavior, operations management, and strategy/entrepreneurship. Prerequisite: junior standing.
Open to Seniors, Juniors & Sophomores only.
Permission is required for interchange registration during the add/drop period only.
65336
Requisite: Overview of organizational behavior, operations management, and strategy/entrepreneurship.  Topics include: Behavioral background of formal organizational life, organizational design, integrating factors in collective behavior, organizational change, systems analysis, techniques of decision making and control, the organization and its environment, and the nature of management theory. Topics grouped in modules of organizational behavior, operations management, and strategy/entrepreneurship. Prerequisite: junior standing.

2016
Sport Management
321

A study of basic marketing concepts with applications to sport organizations, both amateur and professional. Topics include promotions and public relations, sport consumer behavior, strategic market planning, marketing information management, marketing communications, and sponsorship. Prerequisite: MARKETNG 300 or 301.
Open to Senior & Junior Sport Management majors only. Pre Req: MARKETNG 301
Permission is required for interchange registration during the add/drop period only.

Requisite: A study of basic marketing concepts with applications to sport organizations, both amateur and professional. Topics include promotions and public relations, sport consumer behavior, strategic market planning, marketing information management, marketing communications, and sponsorship. Prerequisite: MARKETNG 300 or 301.
